{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3542960,"name":"Justin Spurlock","username":"Snake51","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T22:03:12.158Z","cooked":"

We are trying to use AdvantageScope to simulate our robot’s odometry while our robot is being built and we can’t use it. We looked at the documentation on the AdvantageScope docs, and it told us to add the following lines of code, but not where to add them.

Pose2d poseA = new Pose2d();
    Pose2d poseB = new Pose2d();

    Logger.recordOutput("MyPose", poseA);
    Logger.recordOutput("MyPoseArray", poseA, poseB);
    Logger.recordOutput("MyPoseArray", new Pose2d[] {poseA, poseB});

Where should we add this code? Our code is listed below:

github.com

GitHub - FRC5900/2025_REEFSCAPE

Contribute to FRC5900/2025_REEFSCAPE development by creating an account on GitHub.

Add this in DriveSubsytem just above the constructor.

StructPublisher publisher = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault()
.getStructTopic(“RobotPose”, Pose2d.struct).publish();

Then in periodic() add
publisher.set(getPose());

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-02-27T23:19:10.509Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":493547,"topic_slug":"how-to-display-robot-odometry-in-advantagescope","display_username":"icemannie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28240,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-to-display-robot-odometry-in-advantagescope/493547/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3543029,"name":"Gavin","username":"Gavin0","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gavin0/{size}/193252_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T23:31:05.625Z","cooked":"

If you’re using AdvantageScope, then you’ll want to run the Logger.recordOutput periodically, so it can do in the periodic method of your Drive subsystem. Something like Logger.recordOutput("Swerve/Pose", getPose());

Alternative since you have a getPose method in your drivesubsystem, you can actually just add the @AutoLogOutput annotation above it, and it will log it every periodic automatically.

That would look something like:

@AutoLogOutput
public Pose2d getPose() {
  return m_odometry.getPoseMeters();
}

and that would log it automatically to “DriveSubsystem/Pose”
